concept.title: About DITA Open Toolkit plug-ins
concept.shortdesc: Information about plug-ins that work with DITA Open Toolkit.

prolog.author: Richard Johnson
Anna van Raaphorst
prolog.publisher: OASIS (Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards)

keywords.indexterm: plug-ins overview downloading API reference specialization Java API reference specialization FrameMaker adapter Idiom FO index term list TOC Javascript
specializations API reference Java API reference SKOS RDF thesaurus

section.p: You can download DITA Open Toolkit plug-ins from the following websites:
Key plug-ins are listed in the following table.

strow.stentry: The API reference specialization provides a general-purpose basis for documenting callable programming libraries.

The FrameMaker Adapter (sometimes called the Mekon FrameMaker Adapter or Moldflow FrameMaker Adapter) adds the fmxml output target that allows you to take an existing DITA project and produce a file that can be used as input to FrameMaker 7.x. You can then apply an unstructured FrameMaker template to this content and publish it using FrameMaker functionality. You cannot, however, use FrameMaker functionality to make further changes to the DITA project. The adapter was not designed to be used for authoring DITA content. This is not the Adobe FrameMaker Application Pack for DITA.

The Idiom FO plug-in uses the RenderX XEP processor (in place of the base-level Apache FOP processor) to enhance Toolkit support for PDF processing. The target name is pdf2 (the base-level target name is pdf.) For specific installation instructions, see Installing the Idiom FO plug-in.
The index term list plug-in extracts index terms from a map.
The Java API reference specialization provides a basis for documenting Java class libraries.

The Thesaurus (also called Taxonomy) specialization defines formal subjects and the relationships between them, so you can classify your content. This specialization conforms closely to the SKOS standard and generates RDF.
The TOC Javascript plug-in builds a table of contents for DITA XHTML output.
